description: Presence of blood in stool, indicating possible severe infection, inflammatory bowel disease, or GI bleeding
clinicalSignificance: May indicate invasive bacterial infection (Shigella, Salmonella), amebiasis, or inflammatory bowel disease. Requires immediate evaluation.
recommendedAction: Immediate medical evaluation. Stool culture, complete blood count, electrolytes. Consider hospital admission if severe.

description: Sunken eyes, no tears, dry mouth, decreased skin turgor, altered consciousness, no urine output
clinicalSignificance: Life-threatening condition requiring immediate fluid resuscitation. High risk of shock and organ failure.
recommendedAction: Immediate IV fluid resuscitation. Monitor vital signs, urine output, electrolytes. Hospital admission.

nameAr: حمى شديدة في رضيع أقل من 3 أشهر
description: Fever >38°C (100.4°F) in infant younger than 3 months
clinicalSignificance: High risk of serious bacterial infection (sepsis, meningitis, UTI). Immature immune system cannot localize infection.
recommendedAction: Immediate evaluation. Full sepsis workup (blood culture, urine culture, lumbar puncture). Empiric IV antibiotics. Hospital admission.

description: Fruity breath, rapid breathing, confusion, severe abdominal pain, vomiting in diabetic patient
clinicalSignificance: Life-threatening complication of diabetes. Requires immediate insulin and fluid therapy.
recommendedAction: Immediate hospital admission. IV insulin, IV fluids, electrolyte monitoring. ICU if severe.

description: Confusion, sweating, tremors, loss of consciousness in diabetic patient
clinicalSignificance: Can lead to seizures, coma, and death if not treated immediately.
recommendedAction: Immediate glucose administration (oral if conscious, IV if unconscious). Check blood glucose. Identify cause.
facilityRequired: Any healthcare facility or emergency services

description: Red, swollen, warm foot with or without discharge in diabetic patient
clinicalSignificance: High risk of amputation if not treated promptly. Can lead to sepsis.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation by specialist. Broad-spectrum antibiotics. Wound care. May require surgical debridement.

description: BP >180/120 with symptoms (chest pain, shortness of breath, severe headache, vision changes, confusion)
clinicalSignificance: Acute end-organ damage occurring. Risk of stroke, heart attack, kidney failure.
recommendedAction: Immediate hospital admission. IV antihypertensives. Monitor for organ damage (ECG, troponin, creatinine, neurological exam).

description: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call emergency
clinicalSignificance: Time-sensitive emergency. Every minute counts. Thrombolysis effective within 4.5 hours.
recommendedAction: Call emergency services immediately. Do not delay. CT scan. Consider thrombolysis if within window. Stroke unit admission.
facilityRequired: Hospital with stroke unit and CT capabilities

nameEn: Acute Chest Pain with Cardiac Features
nameAr: ألم صدري حاد مع علامات قلبية
description: Crushing chest pain, radiating to arm/jaw, with sweating, nausea, shortness of breath
clinicalSignificance: Possible acute myocardial infarction. Time-sensitive emergency. Early reperfusion saves myocardium.
recommendedAction: Call emergency services. Aspirin 300mg. ECG within 10 minutes. Troponin. Consider thrombolysis or PCI.

description: Unable to speak in sentences, respiratory rate >30, heart rate >120, oxygen saturation <90%
clinicalSignificance: Life-threatening asthma. Risk of respiratory failure and death.
recommendedAction: Immediate oxygen therapy. Nebulized bronchodilators. IV/oral corticosteroids. Consider IV magnesium. ICU if not improving.

description: Absence of wheezing in severe asthma exacerbation due to minimal air movement
clinicalSignificance: Ominous sign indicating impending respiratory failure. Requires immediate intubation.
recommendedAction: Immediate ICU admission. Prepare for intubation. Aggressive bronchodilator therapy. IV corticosteroids.

description: Blue discoloration of lips, tongue, or nail beds indicating low oxygen
clinicalSignificance: Severe hypoxemia. Risk of organ damage and death.
recommendedAction: Immediate oxygen therapy. Identify and treat underlying cause. Monitor oxygen saturation. Consider intubation if not improving.
facilityRequired: Emergency room with oxygen and intubation capabilities

nameAr: معدل تنفس أكثر من 30 أو أقل من 10
description: Abnormally high or low respiratory rate
clinicalSignificance: Indicates severe respiratory distress or respiratory depression. High risk of respiratory failure.
recommendedAction: Immediate evaluation. Oxygen therapy. Identify cause. Consider intubation if deteriorating.

description: Confusion, drowsiness, or decreased consciousness with fever
clinicalSignificance: Possible meningitis, encephalitis, or sepsis. Life-threatening if not treated immediately.
recommendedAction: Immediate hospital admission. Blood cultures. Lumbar puncture (if no contraindications). Empiric IV antibiotics (do not delay for LP). CT scan if focal signs.

description: Oxygen saturation below 90% on room air
clinicalSignificance: Severe hypoxemia. Risk of organ damage.
recommendedAction: Immediate oxygen therapy. Identify and treat underlying cause. Consider hospital admission.

description: Coughing up blood or blood-stained sputum
clinicalSignificance: May indicate TB, lung cancer, pulmonary embolism, or severe pneumonia. Massive hemoptysis is life-threatening.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Chest X-ray. Sputum for AFB. Consider CT chest. Bronchoscopy if massive. Hospital admission if significant.
facilityRequired: Hospital with imaging and bronchoscopy capabilities

nameEn: Chronic Cough >3 Weeks with Weight Loss
nameAr: سعال مزمن أكثر من 3 أسابيع مع فقدان وزن
description: Persistent cough for more than 3 weeks accompanied by unintentional weight loss
clinicalSignificance: High suspicion for tuberculosis or lung cancer. Requires immediate investigation.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Chest X-ray. Sputum for AFB (3 samples). Consider CT chest. Referral to specialist.
facilityRequired: Hospital with imaging and TB diagnostic capabilities

description: Profuse night sweats soaking clothes/sheets with unintentional weight loss
clinicalSignificance: Classic B symptoms suggesting TB, lymphoma, or other serious conditions.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Chest X-ray. Sputum for AFB. Complete blood count. HIV test. Consider CT scan.

description: Vomiting blood or coffee-ground material
clinicalSignificance: Upper GI bleeding. Can be life-threatening if massive. High risk of shock.
recommendedAction: Immediate hospital admission. IV access. Fluid resuscitation. Blood transfusion if needed. Urgent endoscopy. ICU if unstable.
facilityRequired: Hospital with endoscopy and ICU capabilities

description: Black, tarry, foul-smelling stools indicating upper GI bleeding
clinicalSignificance: Upper GI bleeding. Requires urgent evaluation and possible endoscopy.
recommendedAction: Urgent hospital evaluation. Complete blood count. Type and cross-match. Consider endoscopy. Hospital admission.

description: Severe abdominal pain with board-like rigidity of abdomen
clinicalSignificance: Acute abdomen suggesting peritonitis, perforation, or ischemia. Surgical emergency.
recommendedAction: Immediate surgical consultation. IV access. NPO. Imaging (CT or ultrasound). Prepare for emergency surgery.

description: Pain in back/side below ribs with fever, indicating pyelonephritis
clinicalSignificance: Kidney infection. Risk of sepsis if not treated. Can progress to kidney abscess.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Urine culture. Blood culture if toxic. IV antibiotics. Hospital admission if severe or unable to tolerate oral.

description: Visible blood in urine
clinicalSignificance: May indicate infection, stones, trauma, or malignancy. Requires investigation.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Urinalysis. Urine culture. Imaging (ultrasound or CT). Referral to urologist if no infection.

description: Unable to pass urine despite urge (urinary retention)
clinicalSignificance: Painful and distressing. Risk of bladder damage and kidney injury if prolonged.
recommendedAction: Urgent catheterization. Identify cause (BPH, obstruction, neurological). Urology referral.

description: Single joint that is hot, red, swollen, and extremely painful
clinicalSignificance: Possible septic arthritis or gout. Septic arthritis is a surgical emergency.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Joint aspiration. Synovial fluid analysis. Blood cultures. IV antibiotics if septic. Orthopedic consultation.

description: Unable to put weight on leg or walk
clinicalSignificance: Possible fracture, severe sprain, or septic arthritis. Requires imaging.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. X-ray. Immobilization. Orthopedic consultation if fracture.

nameAr: زيادة سريعة في الوزن مع تورم
description: Sudden weight gain (>2 kg in 3 days) with leg swelling and shortness of breath
clinicalSignificance: Possible heart failure decompensation. Risk of pulmonary edema.
recommendedAction: Urgent evaluation. Chest X-ray. ECG. BNP. Diuretics. Hospital admission if severe.

description: BMI >40 with diabetes, hypertension, sleep apnea, or cardiovascular disease
clinicalSignificance: High risk of cardiovascular events, diabetes complications, and premature death.
recommendedAction: Comprehensive evaluation. Screen for complications. Intensive lifestyle intervention. Consider bariatric surgery referral.
